summary: Over 10 years working experiences in the clinical trial as CRA and PM role at national academic research institution, contract research organization and pharmaceutical company. I am highly motivated and dedicated clinical project manager with 6 years’ experience in Taiwan. In addition, I lead local team on many different indications including various cancer types and non-cancer diseases. I have excellent organization and communication skills meaning that I excel at leading a team, ensuring all projects are completed on schedule, and maintaining the good cooperation with stakeholders. In my role I was responsible for SMM(site management and monitoring) lead at global study team to provide the best study operation under company’s SOP and ICH-GCP. I am looking to take on new challenges including more complex project and leading a bigger team.

currentPositions.description:
Outline:
Managed 8 studies for oncology studies such as, BC, NSCLS, HCC, GC, urothelial cancer and cervical cancer, as well non-oncology studies including Asthma, and CKD. My responsibility covers from study initiation, enrollment period, to the study audit and study closeout. In addition, I'm also taking SMM lead as global role to provide the best action with other global functional team and local country team on aspect of site monitoring and management.

Key scopes:
1. Has the overall responsibility for the study commitments within the country and for timely delivery of data.
2. Assists in forecasting study timelines, resources, recruitment, budget, study materials and drug supplies.
3. Leads Local Study Team consisting of CRA, CSA, for assigned study/studies
4. Coordinates the site selection process by identifying potential sites/investigators, performing initial Site Quality Risk Assessment, and conducting Site Qualification Visits to evaluate suitability and quality risks.
5. Ensures timely submission to EC/IRB at start up and for the duration of the study. Works together with Regulatory Affairs to ensure timely delivery of application/documents for submissions to Regulatory Authority.
6. Ensures timely preparation of country financial Study Management Agreement (fSMA) and maintains accurate study budget.
7. Oversees, manages and coordinates monitoring activities from site activation through to study closure at country and site level.
8. Review MV reports and pro-actively advice the monitor on study related matters.
9. Proactively identifies risks and facilitates resolution of complex study problems and issues.
10. Contributes to patient recruitment strategy including regular communication with participating Investigators.
11. Perform company SIV and MV to ensure CRA and/or study quality.
12. Review report including site selection reports, SIV reports, MV reports, remote visit reports, site COV reports.
13. Collaborates with Medical Affairs team.
